Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Shay Mavis at 269-243-2725.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Erica Marshall, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 – Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/12/25, A youth and a staff member had a physical altercation
in which they were both hitting each other. Staff restrained the
youth to prevent further fighting. The staff member was made to
leave the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 4/14/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported being
on the telephone when Staff 1 redirected her to end the call. She
was reminded to complete her chores and hygiene routine. Youth
A stated she eventually hung up the phone and, as she was
leaving the office, bumped into Staff 1. She said she believed she
was the last youth to use the phone, so she bent down to move
the door stopper to allow the door to close. Youth A said she left
the office but remembered her journal was still inside, so she went
back to retrieve it. As she attempted to re-enter, Staff 1 blocked
her from entering. Youth A stated she pushed Staff 1 and then
Staff 1 pushed Youth A against the wall and grabbed her shirt.
Youth A reported scraping her back on the wall. Youth A stated
she began punching Staff 1, who punched her back. She admitted
to spitting on Staff 1 after punches were exchanged. Youth A said
Staff 1 struck her above the eyebrow. Staff 2 intervened and
escorted Staff 1 out of the office, while Youth A remained inside
with Staff 3. According to Youth A, Staff 1 yelled, "Don’t let that
bitch come out," while banging on the office door window. Youth A
stated she never had previous conflicts with Staff 1. Staff offered
medical attention, but Youth A declined due to being upset. Youth
A stated she was scheduled to see the nurse on the day of the
interview, 4/14/24.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 4/14/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B was present
when the incident occurred. Youth B reported Staff 1 asked Youth
B to step out of the office. Youth B said Youth A responded by
telling Staff 1 to "Shut the fuck up." Youth B reported Youth A
hung up the phone and pushed the chair she was sitting in. Youth
B saw Youth A brush past Staff 1. Youth B said Staff 1 attempted
to redirect Youth A, but Youth A got in Staff 1’s face. Youth B
stated Staff 1 asked Youth A to get out of her face. Youth A
retaliated by punching Staff 1 with a closed fist. Youth A pulled
Staff 1’s hair, held her down by the hair, and punched Staff 1.
Youth B reported Youth A threw the first punch. Youth B reported
2

Youth A hit Staff 1 multiple times in the head. Youth B saw Staff 1
punch Youth A back but was unsure if the punches hit Youth A, as
Youth A was holding Staff 1 down by her hair. Youth B reported
seeing Youth A spit on Staff 1, and spit was all over Staff 1’s body.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 intervened, attempting to separate Youth A and
Youth B. Youth B did not see any visible marks or bruises on
Youth A but saw Staff 1 appeared visibly upset. Youth B reported
Staff 1 was screaming and banging on the office window, shouting
"Come out of the office, because I do not play with fluids." Both
Staff 1 and Youth B screamed and cursed at each other.
Staff 1 interviewed by MDHHS Worker face to face in home on
5/29/25 while Consultant was present via phone. Staff 1
reported that she and Youth A were in the back part of the pod
and the other youth were doing chores. Staff 1 attempted to
redirect Youth A from using the phone, but Youth A did not
comply. Staff 2 also attempted to intervene. According to Staff 1,
Youth A was on the phone from approximately 7:00 PM to 7:21
PM, until Staff 2 returned to the office. Staff 2 reminded Youth A
about completing her chores and hygiene routine. Staff 1
observed Youth A becoming disrespectful toward Staff 2. Staff 1
attempted to assist, but Youth A began cursing at Staff 2, telling
her to “shut the fuck up.” Staff 2 then left the pod to inform staff 4
Youth A was still using the phone. Staff 1 continued redirecting
Youth A, reminding her of her responsibilities. Staff 1 positioned
herself in the office doorway to maintain supervision of the other
youth and uphold the staff-to-youth ratio. As Youth A exited the
office, Youth A attempted to slam the door, which was prevented
by a door stopper. Youth A mumbled, “get the fuck out of my
face.” Staff 1 stepped further into the office to give Youth A more
space to leave the office. Staff 1 reported Youth A then grabbed
her hair. In response, Staff 1 attempted to do a push and pull hair
release technique on Youth A by grabbing her left wrist, using
trained restraint techniques. Staff 1 reported that she was using
her other hand to try and grab Youth A hand and prevent her from
swinging, and she also was holding her arms up to block Youth A
punches. Staff 1 reported Youth A spit in her eye. Staff 1 reported
that there are "too many people with too many things" to be
getting spit on especially in the eye. Staff 1 reported Youth
refused to let go of her hair, but she denied that she swung on
Youth A. Staff 3 also denied making threats to harm Youth A.
Staff 1 described how she never been spit on and how it angered
her. Staff 1 admitted to acting erratically after the incident,
because she was so angry. Staff 3 entered the office, followed by
Staff 4. Staff 1 admitted she was upset but denied hitting Youth A.
She reported sustaining a scratch on her forehead. Staff 1
3

reported she was terminated from Vista Maria due to her actions
after the incident but not during the altercation. Staff 1 reported
that she had a cut near her eye/on her forehead from the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via face to face on 4/14/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported observing
Youth A using the phone. She did not hear Staff 1 say anything to
Youth A but knew Youth A had exceeded her time on the phone.
Staff 2 observed Staff 1 to be calm but could see that Youth A was
refusing to follow Staff 1’s instructions, so Staff 2 left to get Staff 4.
Staff 2 reported that as she was returning to the pod, she heard
and saw punches being exchanged between Youth A and Staff 1.
She was unsure who threw the first punch. Staff 2 reported that
Youth A refused a body chart, and Staff 2 did not observe any
injuries on Youth A. Staff 2 stated she had no previous concerns
regarding Staff 1. She reported that she has never seen Staff 1
behave inappropriately with Youth A. Staff 2 mentioned that Youth
A kept approaching Staff 1 to attack.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 5/8/25 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 was at the end of her shift when she
witnessed the incident. Staff 3 saw both Youth A and Staff 1
punching each other with a closed fist but Staff 3 was unsure who
threw the first punch. Staff 3 reported she and Staff 2 restrained
Youth A by removing Youth A’s grip on Staff 1. Staff 2 told Staff 1
to leave the area. It’s reported Staff 1 was visibly upset and kept
screaming she “does not do bodily fluids”. Staff 3 reported
witnessing the spit on Staff 1’s face. Staff 3 reported eventually,
Staff 1 left the building.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 4/24/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she was on
her way to pass medication when Staff 2 approached her about
Youth A refusing to get off the phone for Staff 1. Youth A was
reportedly threatening a "clear." Staff 4 stated she heard "clear"
and ran to the front. Staff 4 heard Staff 1 and Youth A screaming
and yelling at one another. Staff 4 said Staff 1 repeatedly yelled
Youth A had spit in her face. Staff 4 reported she was able to
separate Youth A and Staff 1, noting Staff 1 was extremely upset.
Staff 1 was reportedly difficult to deescalate and kept saying,
"Bitch, I don’t do bodily fluids," while punching the window. Staff 4
said Staff 1 stated, "She spit in my face." Staff 3 did not observe
any visible marks or bruises on Youth A. Youth A was offered a
body chart but refused. Staff 3 stated she has never seen Staff 1
behave inappropriately with other youth in the facility. Staff 4
expressed surprise at how Staff 1 reacted during the incident.
4

Video Reviewed:
Video Footage from 4/12/24 was viewed on 4/14/25. It should be
noted the video does not have audio. Staff 1 is observed inside
the doorway of an inner office talking to Youth A. Staff 1 spoke to
Youth from the entranceway of the office. Youth A got up from the
desk and proceeded to leave the office. Staff 1 is observed to step
out of the office to let Youth A out of the office. While leaving out,
Youth A is observed kicking the door stop from up under the door.
Staff 1 stepped into the door and Youth A pushed Staff 1 against
the door. Youth A is seen punching Staff 1 with a closed fist
multiple times. Staff 1 is seen trying to block Youth A punches.
Staff 1 is seen holding her arms up with her head turned away
from the punches from Youth A. Youth A continued to punch Staff
1, who then was able to move Youth A towards the office window,
but Youth A still ahold of Staff 1’s shirt. Youth A held onto Staff 1’s
shirt while Staff 1 struggled to get loose. Staff 3 and Staff 2 were
seen entering the office to intervene. They were able to separate
and restrain Youth A from Staff 1. However, Staff 1 continued to
go towards the youth even after being separated from her. Staff 1
was observed in a fight defensive stance with her fists balled up
even after she was separated from Youth A. Staff 1 was observed
punching at Youth A with a closed fist but it’s unclear if the punch
made contact with Youth A. Staff 1 was observed to be highly
upset and enraged as she tossed what looked to be her ID out of
her hands towards the youth, but it landed on the floor. Staff 4 was
seen on video entering the office to intervene and leaving out with
Staff 1. Staff 4 ensured the door was locked. Staff 1 was seen
outside the door still screaming at Youth A, who was inside the
office. Staff 1 was seen banging on the window yelling at Youth A
before leaving the area with Staff 4.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1’s most recent restraint
training was completed on February 13, 2025. There were
no disciplinary actions found in the file. However, effective
4/16/24 Staff 1 was terminated due to misconduct and
violation of Employee policy 022-114.
• Incident Report authored by Staff 2 dated 4/12/24 was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management: This policy
states physical intervention shall not be used as a form of
coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation by staff.
• Policy POL-022-114 – Employee Behavior:
This policy prohibits staff behavior such as fighting,
assaulting, threatening, or intimidating clients.
5

• Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and appropriate
conduct in all interactions with clients. Employees must
foster mutual trust and establish positive working
relationships. The policy explicitly states that corporal
punishment including spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, or pulling hair is strictly prohibited
under any circumstances.
Analysis The agency was found to be in violation. Staff 1 and Youth A
were observed on video fighting each other. The altercation was
also witnessed by Staff 2, 3, 4 and Youth B, who reported Youth A
and Staff 1 physically fought each other inside the office. This
behavior violated the agency’s Behavioral Management Policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 – Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 was observed on video, screaming and banging on the
window antagonizing Youth A.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 4/14/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. According to Youth A,
Staff 1 yelled, "Don’t let that bitch come out," while banging on the
office door window.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 4/14/25
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported Staff 1
was seen screaming and banging on the office window, shouting
"Come out of the office, because I do not play with fluids." Both
Staff 1 and Youth B screamed and cursed at each other.
Staff 1 interviewed by MDHHS staff face to face in home.
Consultant was present via phone on 5/9/25. A follow-up
interview with Staff 1 was held via telephone on 5/28/25.
Staff 1 reported Youth A spit into her eye during the altercation.
Staff 1 reported she was angry that Youth A spit on her and was
unsure how to address this behavior from Youth A.
6

Staff 1 reported that there are "too many people with too many
things" to be getting spit on especially in the eye. Staff 1 reported
Youth A refused to let go of her hair, but she denied she swung on
Youth A. Staff 1 described how she never been spit on and how it
angered her. Staff 1 admitted to acting erratically after the
incident, because she was so angry. Staff 1 reported she was
terminated from Vista Maria due to her actions after the incident
but not her actions during the altercation. Staff 1 reported that she
had a cut near her eye/on her forehead from the incident. Staff 1
did not recall if she made threats to Youth A, but knows she was
distraught about Youth A spit. Staff 1 reported that she kept
repeating while banging on the window that she could not believe
Youth A spit on her, but did not make threats to continue the fight
with Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone at Vista on 4/24/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 and Youth A could
be heard screaming and yelling at one another. Staff 4 said Staff 1
repeatedly yelled that Youth A had spit in her face. She reported
being able to separate Youth A and Staff 1, noting that Staff 1 was
extremely upset. Staff 1 was reportedly difficult to deescalate and
kept saying, "Bitch, I don’t do bodily fluids," while punching the
window. Staff 4 said Staff 1 stated, "She spit in my face." Staff 4
expressed surprise at how Staff 1 reacted during the incident.
Video Reviewed:
Video Footage from 4/12/24 was viewed on 4/14/25. It should be
noted the video does not have audio, so it is unknown what Staff 1
said to Youth A. Staff 1 was seen outside the door screaming at
Youth A, who was inside the office. Staff 1 was seen banging on
the window yelling at Youth A before leaving the area with Staff 4.
Documents reviewed on 4/14/25:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1’s most recent restraint
training was completed on February 13, 2025. There were
no disciplinary actions found in the file. However, effective
4/16/24 Staff 1 was terminated due to misconduct and
violation of Employee policy 022-114.
• Incident Report authored by Staff 2 dated 4/12/24 was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management: Prohibits the
use of profanity or abusive language directed at or in the
presence of clients.
7

• Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and appropriate
conduct in all interactions with clients. Employees must
foster mutual trust and establish positive working
relationships.
The agency was found to be in violation as Youth A, Youth B, and
Staff 4 all stated Staff 1 yelled and screamed at Youth A. In
addition, Youth A and Staff 4 also stated Staff 1 cussed at Youth A
while yelling at her. This behavior violated the agency’s Behavioral
Management Policy. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 was difficult to de-
escalate as she kept yelling, continued to approach Youth A in an
aggressive manner with her fists clenched, and banging on the
inner office window aggressively.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR #2024SIC0001371 dated 5/17/24; CAP approved 10/21/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the current license status be continued.
